Articles.Content: There is a building in the space center called "Mission Control" but it is not currently active, does anyone know when it will become active and what it will do?
Wouldn't be surprised if it had to do with career mode.
The non-clickable building in KSC? Maybe it will become the place where players can select missions to complete for prize in career mode or its pre-release.
I guess we'll be able to do some pre-launch planning and mission management from there, and maybe select which missions we want to do and stuff.

it's probably going to be used to either accept missions for carrer mode or view your current game progress(since the devs have already started the player tracking system) it's probably safe to assume it will become active in .22 if not .23, and I'd be very surprised if by .23 they didn't have it

it's probably going to be used to either accept missions for carrer mode or view your current game progress

My thoughts exactly. It will probably let you check your records, look at accomplishments, select missions... maybe manage budget or something too?
